publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: An Innkeepers daughter at Ockingham (who is very pretty,) at the Sign of the Rose.
Says my Uncle, I pray you discover What has been the cause of yoṛ Woes,
That you pine, & you whine like a Lover?I've seen Molly Mog of the Rose.2.
Oh Nephew, Your grief is but folly, In town you may find better prog,
Half a Crown there will get you a Molly,A Molly much better than Mog.3.
The Schoolboys delight in a playday, The Schoolmasters joy is to flog,
Fop is the delight of a Lady,But mine is in Sweet Molly Mog.4.
Will-a-Wisp leads the Traveller gadding Thro' Ditch, thro' Quagmire, & Bog,
No light can e're sett me a paddingBut the Eyes of my Sweet Molly Mog.5.
For Guineas in other Mens breeches, Yoṛ Gamesters will palm & will Cog,
But I envy them none of their RichesSo I palm but my Sweet Molly Mog.6.
The Hart that's half wounded, is ranging, It here & there leaps like a Frog,
But my heart can never be changingIt's so fix't on my Sweet Molly Mog.7.
I know that by Witts 'tis recited, That Women at best are a clog,
But I'm not so easily frightedFrom loving my Sweet Molly Mog.8.
A Letter when I am inditing, Comes Cupid and gives me a jog,
And I fill all my paper with writingOf Nothing but Sweet Molly Mog.9.
I feel I'm in love to distraction, My Senses are lost in a Fog,
And in nothing can find Satisfaction,But in thoughts of my Sweet Molly Mog.10.
If I would not give up the 3 Graces, I wish I was hang'd like a Dog,
And at Court all the Drawing room faces,For a Glance at my Sweet Molly Mog.11.
For those Faces want Nature & Spirit, And seem as cutt out of a log,
Iuno, Venus, & Pallas's merittUnite in my Sweet Molly Mog.12.
Were Virgil alive with his Phillis, And writing another Eclogue,
Both his Phillis & fair AmarillisHe'd give for my Sweet Molly Mog.13.
When Molly comes up with the liquor,Then jealousy setts me agog,
To be sure she's a bitt for the Vicar,And so I shall loose Molly Mog.Y29-174F
